intro: Phacelia carmenensis, commonly known as Carmen phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It has small, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, aiding in water conservation. Carmen phacelia plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is sometimes used in restoration projects due to its ecological value.
